info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 19 at 1:02AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM EDT FOR SOUTHEASTERN TRANSYLVANIA...NORTHWESTERN GREENVILLE AND NORTHEASTERN PICKENS COUNTIES... At 102 AM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Brevard to 4 miles west of Pickens, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Jones Gap State Park, Dupont State Forest, Table Rock State Park, Caesars Head State Park, Pumpkintown, Dacusville, Connestee, Rocky Bottom, Sunset and Sassafras Mountain. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
